title: Meaning of derivative with candy production

content.prompt: On a certain day, the total number of pieces of candy produced by a factory since it opened is modeled by C, a differentiable function of the number of hours since the factory opened. Which of the following is the best interpretation of C'(3) = 500 ?

choices.label: The factory produces 500 pieces of candy during its 3rd hour of operation.
The factory produces 500 pieces of candy in the first 3 hours after it opens.
The factory is producing candy at a rate of 500 pieces per hour, 3 hours after it opens.
The rate at which the factory is producing candy is increasing at a rate of 500 pieces per hour per hour, 3 hours after it opens.

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
